Twitter naj bi bistveno spremenil funkciji retvita in omemb

06 Nov 2019, 13:00


Vodstvo tega spletnega giganta si je pred nekaj leti zadalo cilj, da s svojim delovanjem čim bolj omeji pojav spletnega nadlegovanja. Prav tako so se zavezali, da bodo javnost pogosteje obveščali o nameravanih spremembah na tej priljubljeni družbeni platformi. Njihov izvršni direktor že sledi tem načelom, ko je prejšnji teden pompozno napovedal prepoved političnih oglasov.

V podobnem duhu je pred dnevi nadaljeval Twitterjev podpredsednik, Dantley Davis, ki je razkril nekaj novosti za prihodnje leto. Novosti vključujejo temeljne spremembe v delovanju platforme, še posebej na primeru retvitov in svobodi uporabnikov pri privabljanju drugih v njihov pogovor (brez njihovega dovoljenja).
Kljub napovedanim spremembam pa Davis ni izjavil točnega datuma uvedbe, zato se že pojavljajo ugibanja, ali ne gre le za testne vsebine in raziskovanje možnosti za njihovo dejansko izvedbo. Ob tem je še dodal, “da so to neke ideje, o katerih razmišljamo, kar je del našega delovnega procesa.” 
Konkretno pravi, da se veseli funkcije umika uporabnika iz določenega pogovora, možnost prepovedi retvita na določen tvit, prepoved omenjanja uporabnika brez izrecnega dovoljenja, izbris omembe iz določenega pogovora in funkcijo tvita le v primeru hashtaga, zanimanja (interest) in določenih prijateljev. Kar konkretne napovedi!
Napovedane omejitve
Pri vseh omenjenih izstopata dve funkciji. Prva je prepoved retvita na določen tvit, kar bi potencialno lahko preprečilo masovno širjenje določene misli, kot smo temu še priča danes. Če pogledamo podrobneje, bi lahko šlo tudi za ukrep proti zmanjšanju spletnega nadlegovanja, dodajajo nekateri analitiki. 
Funkcija bi lahko prišla prav tudi vsem, ki se bojijo, da bi bil njihov tvit napačno razumljen. Obiskovalci bi si tvit še vedno lahko ogledali, če bi obiskali vaš profil, ne bi pa se mogel razširiti tako kot danes. Možnost retvita so sicer dodali pred točno desetimi leti, poudarjajo pa, da prvotna Twitterjeva namera o večjem dosegu ni bila dobro premišljena in da je Twitter zaradi funkcije prav gotovo na slabšem (glasu).
Dorsey je za BuzzFeed sporočil, da razume neko negativno nastrojenost. "Definitivno razmišljam o spodbudah in posledicah vseh dejanj, vključno z retvitom," je takrat dejal. “Retvit s komentarjem lahko na primer spodbudi več razmisleka pred samim širjenjem sporočila.”
Druga napovedana sprememba, ki jo omenja Davis, je še posebej pomembna kot možnost preprečevanja, da bi vas drugi uporabniki omenili brez vašega dovoljenja. To bi lahko tudi korenito spremenilo delovanje Twitterja, če nenadoma ne bi več smeli označevati ljudi v nitih, ne da bi od njih predhodno dobili izrecno odobritev za to. Ponovno se analitikom napovedana funkcija zdi kot ukrep proti spletnemu nadlegovanju.
Javni pozivi so še vedno temeljni element diskurza na Twitterju in javna omemba uporabnika v tvitu, ki ga nekdo kritizira, omogoča ljudem, da lažje sledijo toku dogodkov. Omogoča jim povezavo do vašega profila in zagotavlja, da se vsak odgovor, ki ga pošljejo, prikaže tudi v vaših omembah (odvisno od nastavitev).
To lahko povzroči pravcato poplavo negativnih omemb, zaradi katerih je Twitter dejansko neuporaben, pogosto pa tudi vir (pretiranega) zagrenjenega kritiziranja, ki že meji na nadlegovanje. Čeprav imajo dandanes pri Twitterju boljša orodja za filtriranje in moderiranje negativnih tvitov, se še vedno ni prijetno soočati s plazom neutemeljenih kritik v posamezni omembi. Sposobnost popolnega zmanjšanja učinka tega procesa bi bil dober poskus samokontrole na platformi in bi lahko imel velike posledice na način komuniciranja na Twitterju.
text:
Twitter is expected to make significant changes to its retweet and mention features

06 Nov 2019, 13:00


A few years ago, the leadership of this online giant set itself the goal of limiting the occurrence of cyberbullying through its operations. They have also pledged to keep the public informed more often of the intended changes on this popular social platform. Their CEO is already following those principles when he pompously announced a ban on political ads last week.

In a similar spirit, a few days ago, Twitter's Vice President, Dantley Davis, revealed some news for the coming year. New developments include fundamental changes to how the platform works, especially retweets and users' freedom to engage others (without their permission).
Despite the announced changes, Davis has not stated an exact launch date, so speculations are already emerging as to whether it is just test content and exploring options for their actual implementation. He added, "that these are some ideas we are thinking about, which is part of our work process."
In particular, he says that he looks forward to the function of withdrawing a user from a certain conversation, the ability to prohibit retweets on a specific tweet, prohibiting the mention of the user without explicit permission, deleting the mention from a specific conversation and the function of the tweet only in the case of hashtags, interest (s) and certain friends. What concrete predictions!
Announced restrictions
With all of the above two features stand out. The first is the ban on retweets on a specific tweet, which could potentially prevent the mass spread of a particular thought, as we have witnessed today. Looking closer, it could also be a measure to curb cyberbullying, some analysts add.
The feature could also come in handy for anyone who fears their tweet will be misunderstood. Visitors would still be able to view the tweet if they visited your profile, but it could not be expanded as it is today. The possibility of retweet was added exactly ten years ago, but they point out that Twitter's original intent for greater reach was not well thought out and that Twitter was certainly worse (by voice) due to its function.
Dorsey reported to BuzzFeed that he understood some negative sentiment. "I'm definitely thinking about the incentives and consequences of all the actions, including the retweet," he said at the time. "For example, a comment retit may encourage more thought before spreading the message."
The other announced change mentioned by Davis is especially important as an option to prevent other users from mentioning you without your permission. This could also dramatically change Twitter's performance if you suddenly no longer have to tag people in threads without first getting explicit approval from them. Again, the analyst's announced feature seems like a measure against cyberbullying.
Public calls are still a fundamental element of the Twitter discourse, and the public mention of a user on a tweet that someone criticizes makes it easier for people to follow the course of events. It allows them to link to your profile and ensures that every response they send is also displayed in your mentions (depending on your settings).
This can cause a fair flood of negative mentions that make Twitter actually useless, and often a source of (exaggerated) heated criticism that already borders on harassment. Although Twitter today has better tools for filtering and moderating negative tweets, it is still not comfortable facing an avalanche of unfounded criticism on a single mention. The ability to completely reduce the impact of this process would be a good attempt at self-control on the platform and could have major consequences on the way you communicate on Twitter.
